verb.description: Hit or try to hit with a swinging blow.
examples: she swiped me right across the nose
she lifted her hand to swipe at a cat
someone swiped one of his sausages

verb.description: Pass (a swipe card) through an electronic device designed to read and process the information encoded on it.

examples: he missed the ball with his first swipe

noun.description: An act or instance of moving one's finger across a touchscreen to activate a function.
examples: a swipe to the right archives or deletes the message

phrases: I swiped right, but sadly for me, she swiped left
are elephants more likely to swipe right when they see mates with longer trunks?
He hasn't come up yet, but when he does, I'm swiping right.
Erin met her boyfriend when they both swiped right.
So, on a whim, I downloaded Tinder, quickly created a profile, set my search radius to within 5km, and started swiping right on everyone who seemed like-minded.
origin: Mid 18th century: perhaps a variant of sweep.
